availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Reynolds (1st lieutenant, 10th Kentucky Infantry (Co. A))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, stone cutter and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Luke Reynolds and Elizabeth Reynolds. Stone cutter in Louisville in 1860. First lieutenant in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from November 1861 to May 1863. Authorized to raise a company of twelve-month men from Louisville in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, p. 237.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 807.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0241.
KYR-0002-022-0061.
